Package com.phunware.engagement.location

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    LocationListener
    Used for receiving notifications from the LocationManager when the user enters or exits a monitored location, or when locations are added, removed or modified from the manager. These methods are called if the LocationListener has been added to the LocationManager via the LocationManager.addLocationListener method.
    LocationManager
    LocationManager provides access to nearby Geozones and allows you to perform actions like checking in to a location. You can also supply a LocationListener to be notified of location related events, such as the addition or removal of geo zones, or entry and exit events. To receive geo zone notifications when your Activity is in the foreground, used to perform actions like updating the application UI or displaying additional information, add a LocationListener via the LocationManager.addLocationListener method. Note that you must also remove the listener via LocationManager.removeLocationListener to avoid leaks. To be notified of geo zone events while the app isn't running, you will need to add an android.app.IntentService to your manifest that response to at least one of the following intent-filters: com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_ADDED com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_REMOVED com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_UPDATED com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_ENTERED com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_EXITED com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_CHECK_IN com.phunware.engagement.ZONE_CHECK_IN_FAILURE To ensure your service is only launched for events that you actually handle, you should only register for the actions that are important to you.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    SimpleLocationListener
    Simple implementation of LocationListener with stub implementations of each method. Extend this if you don't intend to override every method of LocationListener.
